embed.title: Quest 2 Straps
embed.description: Please select a strap below for more information, or 'Summary' for an overview.

embeds.title: Quest Straps
embeds.description: The Quest 2 supports modular head straps, and as such, many accessories are available. In the dropdown below, you can see details on several straps, including photos.

fields.name: BOBOVR M2+
fields.value: The BOBOVR M2 is a popular halo-style strap.

fields.name: BOBOVR M2 Pro
fields.value: The BOBOVR M2 Pro is a popular halo-style strap with a built-in battery.

fields.name: Kiwi Elite Strap
fields.value: The Kiwi Elite Strap is similar to the official Elite Strap but without the cracking issue of the official strap, and is known to be comfortable.

fields.name: Vive Deluxe Audio Strap
fields.value: The Vive Deluxe Audio Strap is a solution using a strap designed for a Vive with integrated audio, but is quite costly.

embeds.title: BOBOVR M2+
embeds.description:
The BOBOVR M2+ is a 'halo'-style strap that's very common in the communinity.

It can be found in multiple regions, and is generally known to be a good overall choice for comfort and value.

fields.name: Info
fields.value:
__Included Battery__: No 
 __Included Audio__: No

fields.name: Store Links
fields.value: [Amazon USA](https://www.amazon.com/BOBOVR-M2-Replacement-Pressure-Comfortable/dp/B08YR8LFH3) [Amazon Canada](https://www.amazon.ca/BOBOVR-M2-Adjustable-Cushion%EF%BC%8CReplacement-Strap%EF%BC%8CIncrease/dp/B093WNWZRR/) [Amazon UK](https://www.amazon.co.uk/BOBOVR-Replacement-Accessories-Adjustable-Pressure-M2-Strap/dp/B094J91ST9) [AliExpress](https://www.aliexpress.com/i/1005002558081445.html)

embeds.title: BOBOVR M2 Pro
embeds.description:
The BOBOVR M2 PRO is a 'halo' style strap that's relatively new and a sucessor to the BOBOVR M2, but has an included hotswappable battery.

It's a bit harder to find due to the battery but is generally known to be a good overall choice for comfort and value compared to other options like the Elite Battery Strap.

fields.name: Info
fields.value:
__Included Battery__: Yes 
 __Included Audio__: No

fields.name: Store Links
fields.value: [Amazon USA](https://www.amazon.com/BOBOVR-M2-Pro-Lightweight-Replaceable/dp/B09JNR4Y15) [Amazon Canada](https://www.amazon.ca/BOBOVR-M2-Pro-Lightweight-Uninterrupted/dp/B09JNR4Y15) [Amazon UK](https://www.amazon.co.uk/BOBOVR-M2-Battery-Replacement-Accessories-White/dp/B09KNF4Q9G) [AliExpress](https://www.aliexpress.com/i/1005002558081445.html)

embeds.title: Kiwi Elite Strap
embeds.description:
The Kiwi Elite Strap is an upgraded strap in the style of the official Elite Strap with a nice cushioned top and head cushion.
 One of the main benefits of this is that it's able to fit in the official case and third party cases.

fields.name: Info
fields.value:
__Included Battery__: No 
 __Included Audio__: No

fields.name: Store Links
fields.value: [Amazon USA](https://www.amazon.com/KIWI-design-Accessories-Enhanced-Support/dp/B098JTDPQC) [Amazon Canada](https://www.amazon.ca/KIWI-design-Upgraded-Enhanced-Support/dp/B098JTDPQC) [UK](https://www.amazon.co.uk/KIWI-design-Upgraded-Accessories-Enhanced-Head-Strap/dp/B098JTDPQC), [AliExpress](https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005003162851232.html)

embeds.title: Vive Deluxe Audio Strap
embeds.description:
The Vive Deluxe Audio Strap is a popular strap due to the integrated audio. However, it is not as popular as it once was due to pricing. 
 The Quest 2 has modular strap attachments that support third party straps designed specifically for Quest 2, and as such, other straps like the BOBOVR and Kiwi have been made for far cheaper.

 You can get a Vive Deluxe Audio Strap for $100 typically, but you also need a 3D-printed adapter. 
 If you do not have a 3D printer, you will have to pay upwards of $20 for the adapter.

fields.name: Info
fields.value:
__Included Battery__: No 
 __Included Audio__: Yes

fields.name: Store Links
fields.value: [Amazon USA](https://www.amazon.com/HTC-Vive-Deluxe-Audio-Strap-pc/dp/B06Y2GDXMC) [Amazon Canada](https://www.amazon.ca/HTC-99HAMR001-00-Deluxe-Audio-Strap/dp/B06Y2GDXMC) [Amazon UK](https://www.amazon.co.uk/VIVE-Deluxe-Audio-Strap-schwarz/dp/B072586SVF)

embed.title: Recommended Routers
embed.description:
The following routers have been reported by numerous users to work reliably.
Sole/Upgrade (AXE) TP-Link AXE300/AXE16000 ($450 US)
Sole/Upgrade (AX) - Asus RT-AX86U ($300 US)
Dedicated (AXE 6E) - TP-Link AXE5400/AXE75 ($160-$200)
Dedicated (AXE 6E) - Davolink Minion 6E ($129 US)
Portable (AC) - Opal GL-SFT1200 ($50 US)
Dedicated (AC) - TP-Link Archer C6 or A6 ($40 US)

TP-Link AX and Huawei routers have been known to have issues we are unable to identify. Higher end TP-Link AX/AXE routers not listed here may work well but as with any router not on this list, should be considered untested.

embed.title: Link Cables
embed.description:
Please select a cable below for more information, or 'Summary' for an overview.
 These are only tested on Quest 1 and 2, except the INIU.

embeds.title: Link Cables
embeds.description: There are many cables available for the Quest, as it only requires a USB 3.0 connection to work. In the dropdown below, you can see details on multiple cables, including photos.

fields.name: KIWI Design Link Cable
fields.value: The Kiwi Design Link Cable is a USB A to C cable that is 5 or 6 meters long, depending on which one you purchase.

fields.name: Syntech Link Cable
fields.value: The Syntech Design Link Cable is a USB A to C cable that is 4, 5, or 6 meters long, depending on which one you purchase.

fields.name: Kuject USB Link Cable
fields.value: Kuject's USB A cable can accept external power, which means even on a weak USB port, it can keep playing forever. (Quest 2 Only)'

fields.name: INIU Link Cable
fields.value: INIU's USB A cable can accept external power, which means even on a weak USB port, it can keep playing forever (Quest 2, Pro & 3)

fields.name: Meta Official Link Cable
fields.value: The official cable is a USB C to C fiber optic cable that makes it lightweight, but fairly expensive.

fields.name: Anker Fiber Link Cable
fields.value: The anker cable is a very similar cable to the official Meta link cable, but is sold by Anker and has slightly different asthetics. It is also USB C to C.

embeds.title: Kiwi Design Link Cable
embeds.description: The Kiwi Design Link Cable is a copper standard cable made by a reputable company.

embed.title: Quest New User Guide
embed.description: Please select a section to start

embeds.title: So you just got it out of the box, now what?

fields.name: Charge
fields.value: Plug in your quest to charge, so after everything is ready you have plenty of battery!

fields.name: Create your account
fields.value: Make your Meta account if you haven't already on the Mobile app.

fields.name: Referrals
fields.value:
Redeem any referrals you got from friends on your Oculus App (only works before activation), or if you need one you can use <#927288276673523782>
 for more information please check out the referrals option.

fields.name: Video Guide
fields.value: Follow the [video guide](https://youtu.be/ZBSiZ5Pcjjg) by Oculus, this will help get you setup in your new Quest.

embeds.title: What are referrals?
embeds.description:
When setting up a Meta Quest 2 or Meta Quest Pro you can use a referral to gain a free $30 in-store credit for the Meta store.
 This has to be done BEFORE setting up the device but can be done with a pre-existing account, this also gives a $30 credit to the provider of the referral link

fields.name: How can a friend send me a referral?
fields.value:
This option, requires your friend/acquaintance to generate a referral link in their Meta Quest app. 
To do this have them go into the Meta Quest app and click Menu at the bottom right, there should be a large blue box that starts the referral process.

fields.name: I don't have a friend to give me a referral
fields.value: That's fine as well! You can check out <#927288276673523782> for referrals, this will guide you to get a random referral with other members of our community.

embeds.title: Anything I should avoid?
embeds.description: As you are new to VR, there are a few things you should consider.

fields.name: Guardian
fields.value:
Make sure you set your guardian in a nice open area with nothing to hit
 I'd personally advise you give a little buffer on top, when your new it's pretty easy to get a bit excited and swing past the guardian as well.

fields.name: Sunlight
fields.value: Make sure you keep the lenses (the part you look into, not the cameras) away from direct sun, as that can burn the displays inside the headset rather quickly.

fields.name: Sickness
fields.value: If you start to feel sick, make sure you take breaks! Pushing through it can make it worse in a lot of cases.

fields.name: Cleaning the lenses
fields.value: Make sure you don't use any cleaning liquids on your lenses, and only use microfiber cloths.

pages.name: What games should I start with?

embeds.title: What games to start with?
embeds.description:
One thing to consider when looking into new games is the comfort rating, as your new to VR you would want to look into more 'comfortable' experiences until you get more familiar with VR.
 Here is some reccomendations to get started.

fields.name: Free
fields.value:
[PokerStars VR](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2370815932930055/)
[VRChat](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/1856672347794301/)
[Rec Room](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2173678582678296/)
(MiReality Pool (MR))[https://www.meta.com/experiences/5796340207136099/]
(Blaston)[https://www.meta.com/experiences/2307085352735834/]

fields.name: Paid - Get Moving
fields.value:
[Beat Saber](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2448060205267927)
[Synth Riders](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2436558143118760)
[The Light Brigade](https://www.meta.com/experiences/2681027292004911/)
[COMPOUND](https://www.meta.com/experiences/5472934942761937/)
[Thrill Of The Fight](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/3008315795852749)

fields.name: Paid - Great Stationary
fields.value:
[I Expect You To Die 2: Spy and the Liar](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2970998659623177)
[Real VR Fishing](https://www.meta.com/experiences/2582932495064035/)
[Puzzling Places](https://www.meta.com/experiences/3931148300302917/)
[Moss: Book 2](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4395292760584049/)
[Tetris Effect: Connected](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/3386618894743567)
[Vermillion](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4900967296622279)

fields.name: Paid - Great Multiplayer
fields.value:
[Among Us VR](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4948428055244413/)
[Demeo](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/3634830803298285)
[Eleven Table Tennis](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/1995434190525828/)
[Contractors](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2436897736439055/)
[Pavlov: Shack](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/3649611198468269/)

fields.name: Paid - Close to Home (Mixed Reality)
fields.value:
[Battle Talent](https://www.meta.com/experiences/8752849024786000/)
[Blockworks](https://www.meta.com/experiences/4795837347172093/)
[Track Craft](https://www.meta.com/experiences/5802051039897223/)
[Neko Atsume Purrfect Kitty Collector](https://www.meta.com/experiences/8401739766534648/)
[Synth Riders](https://www.meta.com/experiences/quest/2436558143118760)
[Angry Birds VR: Isle of Pigs](https://www.meta.com/experiences/2718606324833775/)

fields.name: Other Guides
fields.value: Check out [Gibby's Guide](https://gibbysguide.org/content/gibbysguidev24_lores.pdf) as they make a monthly guide on new content!

pages.name: What else can I do with my quest?

embeds.title: What else can I do?
embeds.description: Looking through the store and can't find something that suits you?

fields.name: Other stores
fields.value: You can check out games on [Sidequest](https://sidequestvr.com/setup-howto), or [App Lab](https://www.applabdb.com/)! There's some great titles like Dr. Beef's large library of ports from older PC games.

fields.name: Explore
fields.value: Explore the world in [Wooorld](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4360608937312293) with friends.

fields.name: Watch Something
fields.value: You can try 3D Movies out in [Bigscreen](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2497738113633933/), either with new friends or old, go solo in Meta Quest TV and check out their collection or join a live event in [Horizon Worlds](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2532035600194083/).

fields.name: Productivity
fields.value: You can be productive, use it as a virtual computer with multi tasking with browsers, or connected to a computer with programs like [Workrooms](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2514011888645651), [Virtual Desktop](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2017050365004772), [vSpacial](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2540393919317658), and [Immersed](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2849273531812512/)

fields.name: PCVR
fields.value: You can also play PC VR games with a [VR Ready PC](https://support.oculus.com/articles/headsets-and-accessories/oculus-link/oculus-link-compatibility/)!

embeds.title: PCVR
embeds.description: As long as you have a VR Ready PC, you can play PC VR either wired or wireless! This does include SteamVR Games as well.

fields.name: Wired
fields.value: You can play wired PC VR using Oculus Link and a USB 3.0 cable.

fields.name: Wireless
fields.value: You can play wirelessly using [Air Link](https://support.oculus.com/airlink/), [Virtual Desktop](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/2017050365004772/), [Steam Link](https://www.meta.com/experiences/5841245619310585/) or [ALVR](https://github.com/alvr-org/ALVR).

fields.name: Where should I buy my games for PCVR?
fields.value: A lot of people prefer Steam, and most people agree - however I would check to see if the game is [crossbuy](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/section/2335732183153590/#/?_k=l5u635) before you buy on steam, as a 'crossbuy' title you can buy on Quest and get on the Rift store and Quest store. (PC and Quest at the same time).

embeds.title: Quest 2 Straps
embeds.description: The Quest has replaceable straps you can find from different vendors, here is the most popular in our community.

fields.name: BOBOVR M2+
fields.value:
The BOBOVR M2+ is a 'halo'-style strap that's very common in the communinity.
 It can be found in multiple regions, from multiple websites. 
 This strap does not have a built in battery.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/BOBOVR-M2-Replacement-Pressure-Comfortable/dp/B08YR8LFH3)

fields.name: BOBOVR M2 Pro
fields.value:
The BOBOVR M2 PRO is a 'halo' style strap that's relatively new and a sucessor to the BOBOVR M2, but has an included hotswappable battery.
 It can be found in most regions, but not as many as the main one as this does support a hotswappable battery, and that can limit it's shipping locations.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Compatible-Connection-Lightweight-Replaceable-Accessories-Quest2/dp/B09JNR4Y15)

fields.name: Kiwi Elite Strap
fields.value:
The Kiwi Elite Strap is an upgraded strap in the style of the official Elite Strap with a nice cushioned top and head cushion.
 One of the main benefits of this is that it's able to fit in the official case and third party cases.
 This does not include a battery.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/KIWI-design-Upgraded-Oculus-Battery/dp/B09JKQXFZY/)

embeds.title: Quest 2 Facial Interfaces
embeds.description: The Quest has a replaceable facial interface, as well as covers you can put over the existing facial interface.

fields.name: Included Silicon Cover
fields.value: Meta now includes a Silicon Cover for the existing facial interface, it's suggested to try this before replacing the interface to see if you are comfortable with it as is.

fields.name: VRCover
fields.value:
VRCover makes multiple different replacement interfaces as well as other accessories, and people have had good results with this as a replacement gasket.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Interface-Replacement-Standard-Not-Machine-Specific/dp/B08HMQK73M)

fields.name: AMVR
fields.value:
AMVR makes a few Quest solutions, and has a gasket designed specifically for airflow that has positive reviews.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/AMVR-Resilient-Anti-Leakage-Replacement-Accessories/dp/B08ZMYF69S)

embeds.title: Quest 2 Controller Grips
embeds.description:
The Quest 2 controllers do include a strap that you put around your wrist.
 Some people however prefer a 'knuckles' style grip that you can let go of the controller and keep playing, here's a few brands below.

fields.name: AUBIKA Grip
fields.value:
The AUBIKA grip is a knuckeles style grip, however it has a built in rechargeable battery, which gets rid of the need for AA's as well, this is a new option that does not have a lot of reviews so far, but current reviews are positive.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Rechargeable-Controller-Oculus-Quest-Accessories-2/dp/B0BHSTZJ94/)

fields.name: Kiwi Grip
fields.value:
Kiwi sells a knuckles style grip that has great reviews and is suitable for larger hands. This does not include a rechargeable battery
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/KIWI-design-Controller-Adjustable-Accessories/dp/B09J8HJMFK/)

fields.name: AMVR Grip
fields.value:
AMVR sells a knuckles style grip that also has a battery door.
 [Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Controller-Anti-Throw-Accessories-Battery-Opening-Adjustable/dp/B09HC4DFVM/)

embeds.title: Quest Link Cables
embeds.description: There are many cables available for the Quest, as it only requires a USB 3.0 connection to work. Here is some examples, but you can find other vendors as well. Only tested on Quest 2.

fields.name: KIWI Design Link Cable
fields.value:
The Kiwi Design Link Cable is a USB A to C cable that is 5 or 6 meters long, depending on which one you purchase.
 [Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/KIWI-design-Accessories-Compatible-Headset/dp/B09N77BGDF)

fields.name: Syntech Link Cable
fields.value:
The Kiwi Design Link Cable is a USB A to C cable that is 4, 5, or 6 meters long, depending on which one you purchase.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Syntech-Compatible-Transfer-Charging-Headset/dp/B098399X91)

fields.name: Kuject USB Link Cable
fields.value:
Kuject's USB A cable is the only one on this list that can accept external power, which means even on a weak USB port, it can keep playing forever. **Not on quest 3** 
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BRKKFJ3X/)

fields.name: INIU Link Cable
fields.value: INIU's USB A cable can accept external power, which means even on a weak USB port, it can keep playing forever (Quest 2, Pro & 3)

fields.name: Meta Official Link Cable
fields.value:
The official cable is a USB C to C fiber optic cable that makes it lightweight, but fairly expensive.
[Amazon US](https://www.amazon.com/Oculus-Virtual-Reality-Headset-Cable-Gaming/dp/B081SHD773)

embeds.title: Support
embeds.description: If you are having issues with your Quest, please check out <#1030166436297064510>

embed.title: Support is volunteer-driven
embed.description:
Be patient, be civil, and be descriptive about your issues.

All support is volunteer driven, we help who we can as we can. Not everyone knows how to help you, and not everyone will. Avoid pinging staff directly, they are volunteers too and will assist when possible.

Be as descriptive as you can with your issue; it's a lot more likely someone will remember something if they see a keyword that helps them.

fields.name: Ask in One Channel
fields.value: Posting the same issue in multiple channel leads to confusion, reduces the willingness of volunteers to assist, and does not accelerate response times. Stick to #support channels for each issue.

embed.title: Quest 3 Straps
embed.description: Please select a strap below for more information, or 'Summary' for an overview.

embeds.title: Quest 3 Straps
embeds.description:
The Quest 3 supports modular head straps, and as such, many accessories are available. In the dropdown below, you can see details on several straps, including photos. 

 **Important:** Quest 2 straps **are not** compatible with Quest 3 out of the box.

fields.name: BOBOVR M3 Mini Sports
fields.value: The BOBOVR M3 mini is a headstrap similar to that of the Meta Elite Strap, but at a cheaper asking price. This is a minimalistic yet comfortable strap.

fields.name: BOBOVR M3 Pro
fields.value: The BOBOVR M3 Pro is a popular halo-style strap with a built-in battery.

fields.name: Kiwi Comfort Headstrap
fields.value: The Kiwi Comfort Headstrap is similar to the official Elite Strap but at a cheaper asking price. This is the same as the last gen Kiwi Elite Strap but is now retrofitted for Quest 3.

fields.name: BOBOVR M2 > M3 Pro Retrofit Kit
fields.value: This kit allows you to retrofit your old M2 Pro strap into a new one that fits the Quest 3s design, saving you the money of having to purchase a new strap all together.

embeds.title: BOBOVR M3 Mini Sports
embeds.description:
The BOBOVR M3 Mini is a new comfort strap in the old fashion Elite strap-style, it is made to fit nicely around the head without interferance around the ears. It is a simplistic yet comfortable strap

It can be found in multiple regions and is a good choice for a comfort upgrade.

 **Note as of 2023-12-29:** Due to shortages this strap is currently unavailable in many places, including certain regional Amazons. The links below might not work

embeds.title: BOBOVR M3 Pro
embeds.description:
The BOBOVR M3 PRO is a 'halo' style strap that's the new version of the M2 Pro retrofitted for the Quest 3, inbuilt comes the function for hotswappable batteries.

It's a bit harder to find due to the battery but is generally known to be a good overall choice for comfort and value compared to other options like the Elite Battery Strap.

The Kiwi Comfort Headstrap is an upgraded strap in the style of the official Elite Strap with a nice cushioned top and head cushion. This is the same as the last generation of the Kiwi Elite Strap but is now retrofitted for the Quest 3
 One of the main benefits of this is that it's able to fit in the official case and third party cases.

name: questplus
description: Info on the Quest Subscription Service, Quest+

embed.title: Meta Quest +
embed.description: The below pages contain info on Meta Quest +, click each one to learn more about the program, or 'Summary' for a brief overview.

embeds.title: Summary
embeds.description: Meta Quest+ is Meta's version of Xbox Gamepass - Get 2 monthly games, selected by Meta, to add to your library each month and explore the **Games Catalog** to add even more!

embeds.title: Monthly Games
embeds.description: Like PlayStation Plus, Meta Quest + grants you access to **two Meta-Curated games** a month, these change every month, and the games being different every month is not guaranteed, you can see what games are free for the month by clicking [here](https://www.meta.com/experiences/meta-quest-plus/)

embeds.title: Game Catalog
embeds.description: As of March 2024, Meta Quest + now offers a game catalog! These games rotate in and out just like Gamepass, check back in every few months to check whats new, you can see a full list of the currently available titles [here](https://www.meta.com/experiences/section/746836817401205/)

pages.name: Do I keep my games after cancelling?
pages.title: Do I keep my games after cancelling?

embeds.title: Do I keep my games after cancelling?
embeds.description:
No, just like Xbox Gamepass or PlayStation Plus, you lose access to your games once your month is over, until your month is over you will have access to your games however.
 As soon as you resubscribe, you'll regain access to all claimed games, regardless if it's still their month or not.

pages.name: Do I get the Rift Versions of these games?
pages.title: Do I get the Rift Versions of these games?

embeds.title: Do I get the Rift Versions of these games?
embeds.description: At this moment, no. However this can change in the future.

name: ipd
description: IPD and Its Importance in VR.

embed.title: IPD and Its Importance in VR.
embed.description: IPD is the distance between the pupils of your eyes. This is important for VR as you need to make sure you are within the supported IPD range of a headset, otherwise you will experience eye strain, focus issues, and other related issues.

fields.name: Common IPD Ranges
fields.value:
Quest 2 - 3 Settings - 58mm, 63mm, 68mm (+/-2.5mm in each direction)
Valve Index - 58-70mm
Reverb G2 - 60-68mm
[VRCompare for more headsets](https://vr-compare.com/)

fields.name: How to check?
fields.value:
There are a few ways to check, but the two main methods are measuring with a ruler in front of a mirror or using the app [EyeMeasure](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/eyemeasure/id1417435049)
 You want the 'Far' IPD from this app.

fields.name: Ruler Method
fields.value:
Stand in front of a mirror and hold a ruler up to your nose, such that the measuring edge runs directly underneath both your pupils.
Close your right eye and look directly at your left eye. Move the ruler so that the 0 mark appears directly underneath the center of your left pupil. Try to keep the ruler still for the next step.
Close your left eye and look directly at your right eye. The mark directly underneath the center of your right pupil is your IPD.

embed.title: General Minimum Specs for VR
embed.description:
OS: Windows 10
CPU: Intel i5-7500 / AMD Ryzen 5 1600 or greater
RAM: 12GB+ RAM
GPU: NVIDIA GTX 1660 Super / AMD Radeon RX 5600XT or greater
USB Ports: 1x 3.1 port
Free Space: 35GB on C:

fields.name: Detailed Info
fields.value:
You can find detailed minimums below, please note minimum does not mean you can play every game.
[Oculus Rift S Supported Specs](https://store.facebook.com/help/quest/articles/getting-started/getting-started-with-rift/rift-s-minimum-requirements/)
[Oculus Link Supported Specs](https://store.facebook.com/help/quest/articles/headsets-and-accessories/oculus-link/oculus-link-compatibility/)
[Valve Index Supported Specs](https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=4061-QUZB-4602)

embed.title: Sidequest
embed.description: Sidequest is a widely known application that allows you to 'sideload' third-party apps and modifications to your Quest.

fields.name: Do I need a VR-ready PC?
fields.value: No, it does not require a VR-ready PC to use, but does require a cable to connect your Quest to your PC (2.0 or 3.0) for the advanced functionality.

fields.name: What does it hold?
fields.value:
Not only does it hold third-party apps, such as mods and fangames, you can also change your recording values, and install mods and apks directly to your headset via your PC.
You can also find custom Home Environments on it.

fields.name: Is it safe?
fields.value: It is accepted (and even endorsed) by Meta and you can find information on how to install it [here](https://sidequestvr.com/setup-howto) with all setup instructions.

embed.title: Oculus Link
embed.description: Oculus Link is a feature built into the Quest that allows you to use your Quest as a PC VR headset while wired into a VR-ready PC.

fields.name: Can I play any VR game?
fields.value: You can generally play any Oculus Rift or SteamVR title while on Link, as long as your PC is capable of running it.

fields.name: What's required?
fields.value:
You need a VR-ready PC that meets the minimum specs, you can find out more details [here](https://support.oculus.com/444256562873335/) as well as a USB 3.0 A-to-C or C-to-C cable.
 You can find more info about this with /linkcables.

embed.title: Air Link
embed.description: Air Link is the wireless PCVR feature introduced in [V28](https://www.oculus.com/blog/introducing-oculus-air-link-a-wireless-way-to-play-pc-vr-games-on-oculus-quest-2-plus-infinite-office-updates-support-for-120-hz-on-quest-2-and-more/)

fields.name: Requirements
fields.value:
1. [VR-Ready PC](https://support.oculus.com/444256562873335), please note this is not 100% of all hardware supported; better graphics cards than listed will work as well. 
2. 5GHz AC or AX network with a wired connection to your PC.

fields.name: FAQ
fields.value:
1. **Is my internet good enough?:** Internet does not matter for Air Link, you only need a good local connection.
2. **Can I play SteamVR on this?:** Yes, SteamVR is fully supported just like wired link.
3. **Is my router good enough?:** If you want more information, look up your router's model number and make sure it's AX or AC, or provide your model number in your help thread.
4. **I'm having issues, where can I get help?:** Please create a thread using #support.

embed.title: Sharing Screenshots of the Performance Overlay
embed.description:
1.) Go into the Settings tab in the Virtual Desktop menu in VR and make sure 'copy screenshots to desktop' is enabled.
2.) Go into the Streaming tab and check 'Show performance overlay'.
3.) Launch your VR game.
4.) Look for numbers that are turning orange.
5.) When you see this, hold right Oculus button and press right trigger or left trigger to take a screenshot.

 The screenshot will be found on your desktop and you can share it here.

embed.title: Quest USB/Link
embed.description:
Connecting your Quest VR headset with your VR ready PC using a USB cable allows you to play VR games from your PC, this includes Oculus rift games and Steam games. However, when purchasing a cable there are a few things to take into account: 

**USB Connection types**
USB cables can come with multiple different connector types, the ones you want to be looking for are USB type A and USB type C. All current Quest devices use a USB C port, which means that your cable needs to have at least *one* USB C connector, the other end can be either A or C; other than their shape and respective port they offer no real difference in this use case and they will perform the same.

**USB standards**
USB standards (data speed simply said) are important for link cables, any link cable used for any of the Quest devices should be USB 3.0, also known as USB 3.1 Gen 1, and USB 3.2 Gen 1x1.
Note that USB 2.0 will provide a very poor experience so avoid using those.
You can find these types of cables on A and C through various retailers at various lengths, performance-wise they are all equal.

**Length**
For an optimal experience you ideally want a cable that is 3-5m long, generally it is not recommended that USB 2.0/3.0 cables are longer than that.

**Battery time with a USB cable**
Playtime will be increased using a cable, but it is not guaranteed that the cable provides infinite playtime. This is a limitation of many motherboards and the cable plays no role.

For cable recommendations with detailed descriptions, use /linkcables.

embed.title: Inside Out Body Tracking
embed.description:
Meta's Inside Out Body Tracking IOBT for the Quest 2 and 3 is a technology that tracks the user's upper body movements using the headset's cameras. This feature allows the VR system to accurately display the user's arms and torso movements in VR. 

Meta has an inside out body tracking demo you can try [here](https://www.meta.com/experiences/6511679575602893/)

embed.title: Recommended GPU Drivers
embed.description:
Nvidia: [Latest drivers](https://www.nvidia.com/download/index.aspx)
AMD RX 400/500: [20.10.1](https://www.amd.com/en/support/kb/release-notes/rn-rad-win-20-10-1)
AMD 5000/6000: [22.11.2](https://www.amd.com/en/support/kb/release-notes/rn-rad-win-22-11-2)
AMD 7000: [23.10.2](https://www.amd.com/en/support/kb/release-notes/rn-rad-win-23-10-2)

embed.title: Please provide more information
embed.description:
All support is volunteer, to be able to have people help it's best if you could provide more information about your computer or issue. 
 Please provide relevent computer information such as your CPU, Graphics Card, and Operating System.
 Additionally, any information you could see to be helpful to further assist, if this is airlink or vd related, your network setup such as router model, and if you are wired can help in these cases too.
 
[You can also contact Oculus before reaching out to the community for help.](https://tickets.oculusvr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

name: airlinkupdate
description: Airlink is no longer in experimental

embed.title: Airlink is no longer in experimental
embed.description: Air Link is out of the experimental settings panel and will now be available under system settings - Link.

embed.title: App Lab
embed.description: For information about App Lab, please see [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/oculusquest/wiki/faq/applab).

embed.title: Virtual Desktop
embed.description:
Virtual Desktop is a Quest application that allows you to use your desktop in VR, watch videos, as well as use it for wireless PC VR with a VR-ready PC.
For first-time setup and general FAQ, please check out [this guide](https://reddit.com/r/OculusQuest/wiki/faq/virtualdesktop), if you need further help, please visit their [Discord](https://discord.gg/fzvaHfpneH)

embed.title: Quest/Rift Cross-Buy Apps
embed.description:
Rift and Quest have some games that support cross-buy, and you can find that list [here](https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/section/2335732183153590/#/?_k=l5u635).
 Please note that cross-buy can only apply between Meta PC and Quest stores, and this does not include any other platform.

embed.title: Extended Reality (XR)
embed.description:
Extended Reality (XR) covers all the different ways we mix computer technology with our real world. Here's what that includes:

**Virtual Reality (VR)**: This is like stepping into a different world. You wear a headset, and everything you see is created by a computer. It's used for video games and other interactive experiences.

**Augmented Reality (AR)**: This adds computer-created elements to the real world. If you've played games where characters appear in the real world on your phone screen, or used a filter to add a hat to your selfie, that's AR!

**Mixed Reality (MR)**: This is a blend of AR and VR. Here, virtual objects are added to the real world and can interact with it. It's like having virtual objects in your living room that you can move and touch.

embed.title: Quest/Rift Crossplay Apps
embed.description:
Rift and Quest have some games that support crossplay (playing multiplayer between different platforms (Steam, Rift, Quest, and/or PSVR)), and you can find that list [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/oculus/wiki/crossplay).
Please note that this is a community-maintained list and will not always be accurate.

embed.title: Valve Support
embed.description: You can contact Valve via a ticket [here](https://help.steampowered.com/en/wizard/HelpWithGame/?appid=250820).

embed.title: Oculus/Meta Support
embed.description: You can contact Oculus Support via either a ticket or live chat [here](https://store.facebook.com/help/support/quest/).

embed.title: Quest Manual Update
embed.description: You can find a guide on how to manually update [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/oculusquest/wiki/guides/manualupdate). You will also need a copy of the firmware you want to update to.

embed.title: Internet isn't used when streaming
embed.description: Once your VR headset is connected to your computer, all data traffic remains local. This is true whether you're connected directly to your main router or to a dedicated router on the same local area network (LAN). The only requirement is a wired connection from your PC to a router. The VR headset then connects wirelessly to the same router or dedicated router.

embed.title: Don't ask to ask; just ask
embed.description:
When you ask 'Hey can anyone help me?', this can be seen as bad form.
 The best way to get assistance is to ask your entire question, with details, in a relevant channel.
 There are plenty of reasons why people that do have the knowledge would not admit to it, but by asking the full question you are asking people to answer a question, not take responsibility to answer the question they may not have the answer to.

embed.title: Half-Life: Alyx - Stutter Fix
embed.description: Right-click Half-Life: Alyx in Steam then click Properties, in 'General' click in 'Launch Options', and paste the following: ```+vr_fidelity_level_auto 0 +vr_fidelity_level 3```

embed.title: Quest Referrals
embed.description:
Meta offers a referral system for the the Quest and Apps over 10$. 
 You can request referrals with /getreferral app or /getreferral device.
 For additional details please choose below.

embeds.title: Main
embeds.description:
Meta offers a referral system for the the Quest and Apps over 10$. 
 You can request referrals with /getreferral app or /getreferral device.
 For additional details please choose below.

embeds.title: Saving Your Referral Links
embeds.description: To save your referral link for the bot to provide users when requested, follow the below instructions.

fields.name: Device
fields.value: Type /savereferral device in any channel you can type in and type or paste your link in. This will only be shown to you.

fields.name: App
fields.value: Type /savereferral app in any channel you can type in and type or paste your link in. In platform select the platform you purchased the game on, this only supports Meta Platforms.

embeds.title: Getting Referral Links
embeds.description: The Referral bot allows you to get randomized links.

fields.name: Device
fields.value: Type /getreferral device in any channel you can type in, the response is only shown to you

fields.name: App
fields.value:
Type /getreferral app, then type in the app name
 This also can be done in any channel you can type in, the response is only shown to you.

embeds.title: What are Referrals?
embeds.description:
Referrals in the Meta Quest Referral Program are a straightforward way for you to engage with other community members by offering them a chance to join the VR world with a bonus or get a new game with a bonus.

 You share a specific link with community members for purchasing Quest devices or select apps and games using our bot, and when they use your link for a purchase, they receive a discount or a bonus, and you earn store credit as a thank you.
 It is beneficial for both sides: community members save on their purchase, and you get credits to use in the Meta Quest Store.

 Our bot is fully randomized and will select your link at random if a user requests it.

embed.title: Quest Factory Reset
embed.description: If you need to factory reset your Quest, please enable [cloud sync](https://support.oculus.com/articles/in-vr-experiences/oculus-features/cloud-sync/) and then follow [these](https://www.meta.com/help/quest/articles/fix-a-problem/troubleshoot-headsets-and-accessories/troubleshooting-factory-reset-quest/) instructions on the factory reset.

embed.title: Quest Cloud Backup
embed.description: You can see what games you own that support cloud backup [here](https://secure.oculus.com/my/cloud-backup/).
